themes.label: Laws and Regulations
themes.rationale: The inscription contains a detailed set of legal provisions and regulations governing the new settlement at Naupaktos, including inheritance, taxation, and judicial procedures.
themes.quote: το ς α τον νομ οις χρεσται

themes.label: Treaties and Agreements
themes.rationale: The text represents a formal agreement or foundation charter between the mother city of the Opuntian Lokrians and the colonists establishing the settlement at Naupaktos.
themes.quote: ν να πακτον κ τ τονδε πι οικ α

themes.label: Bronze
themes.rationale: The physical support of this legal document is a bronze tablet, typical for West Lokrian legal records of the 5th century BC.

themes.label: Intact
themes.rationale: The inscription is largely preserved in its entirety, allowing for a comprehensive understanding of the legal pact.
themes.quote: ν να πακτον κ τ τονδε πι οικ α... τα τ τ λεον ε μεν χαλει οις

persons.name: Antiphates
persons.role: Leader of a group of settlers

rationale: This inscription, known as the 'Statute of the Lokrian Settlers at Naupaktos', is a foundational legal document. It outlines the rights and obligations of the colonists (epioikoi) from Opuntian Lokris who settled in Naupaktos. It covers complex legal ground including dual citizenship, inheritance laws for those dying in the colony, tax exemptions, and the specific judicial procedures to be followed in disputes between the colonists and the mother city. The mention of Antiphates at the end suggests a specific group or sub-settlement associated with him.
